blog.name: halfprincesshalfgoddess
blog.title: half princess, half goddess
blog.description:
I'm Diana.
Books and movies are my obsession.
TV shows and beauty my addiction.
Writing and traveling my passion.
Food and laughter my god.
Welcome to my consciousness.

summary: who would you like to see on the iron throne, if anyone?
question: who would you like to see on the iron throne, if anyone?
answer:
Jon, of course. He gains nothing from saving the world. And personally, he’s not afraid to die — he’s been there. So why make it his ultimate mission to triumph against the enemy? Simply because he cares about humanity.

Yeah, Dany cares as well. But that’s mostly because she’s been wanting her whole life to rule the kingdoms. She’s not half as selfish as Cersei, but you have to admit, she’s got a self-serving reason. It’s not just good will.

Arya is my favorite. But not only does she not want to rule, she doesn’t care much about the world either. Arya strikes me as more trees than forest. She’ll kill and die for her family and friends and will eagerly help strangers in the vicinity. But the bigger picture? I don’t see her getting emotionally attached to something so distant and abstract.

Sansa is an opening act, not a headliner. A supporting character, not the lead. I don’t find her worthy. Sure, she’s had one hell of a journey. So has Theon. So has The Hound. So has Cersei. Doesn’t mean they all deserve the grand prize.

Gendry shouldn’t be king just because he’s a Baratheon. Tyrion shouldn’t be either just because he’s smart. (And to be honest, his wits have been failing him for a while now.) Cersei’s just bad news. Old news too. (Personally love her, though.) And Jaime shouldn’t even be a candidate. It’s already Season 8 and he only just woke up. LOL

So yeah, it’s a no-brainer for me. Jon is like Harry Potter. The reason Harry was able to grab the sorcerer’s stone was because he’d never intended to use it. He just wanted to keep it safe. In the same way, Jon doesn’t intend to rule the realm. He just wants to rescue it. Maybe that’s how it’ll work here too.

But frankly, there might not even be a throne at all halfway through Season 8.

summary: ‪GRRM speaks how important is Targaryens blood mariage. How important is to protect their blood. How different they are. They...
body:
‪GRRM speaks how important is Targaryens blood mariage. How important is to protect their blood. How different they are. They aren’t like other people of Westeros. Just read. It’s Genial ‬

How Dany is always his favorite. He practically said that books is all about her. Just reading . Targaryens, dragons are always his favorite

“ of course than Dany you know… so, that’s what the books all about…”

He practically speaks how important is Dany and Jon’s marriage for future of House Targaryen. He speaks how important is to protect blood if you want to control dragons . There is no way without Jonerys future. Jon can’t protect and continue line of House Targaryen without Daenerys while she is full Targaryen blood and Jon is half Targaryen. If he merry with another women who especially isn’t blood of the dragons Targaryen house will lose. Jon’s blood isn’t strong. He is half wolf.

tags: could sam reasonably be expected to know that was arya and bring her back to jon? no
will jon be swayed by this logic? also no
summary: At some point, Jon will find out that Sam met Arya in Braavos and did nothing to bring her back to him. And when he does find...
body:
At some point, Jon will find out that Sam met Arya in Braavos and did nothing to bring her back to him. And when he does find out, he will be petty about it for approximately ever.

Sam: Could you bring me that book over on the table?

Jon: I don’t know. Did you bring me my little sister?

Sam: It’s been FORTY YEARS.

summary: A King, A Queen, A Cloak written for @jonsadrabbles as a part of Jonsa Drabbles Fest Round 2 (lol “drabble”) Day 6:  Tears 〜...
body:
A King, A Queen, A Cloak

written for @jonsadrabbles as a part of Jonsa Drabbles Fest Round 2 (lol “drabble”)

Day 6:  Tears 〜 Furs

Pairings: Jon Snow/Sansa Stark

Trigger warnings: none

Summary: The war is over. The Starks reign victorious. After a long courtship, Jon and Sansa decide to get married and move to King’s Landing where they’ll be named King and Queen. This is a nostalgic fic based on the day of their wedding :)

Mere hours before the ceremony begins, Jon finds Sansa in her old chambers, her head bent over her finished work, fawning like a proud mother of a newborn babe. He thinks of how endearing the picture is: early morning rays laving the room in a burnished glow, new décor on the chamber-walls painted like a foliage of birds, wafting essence of spring flowers from an open casement. And then there is Sansa herself: the play of sun in her red hair, water blue eyes like the sea sapphires of White Harbor. There is something poignant about the way she is seated-she looks like a saint. He decides to leave, to not destroy the fragile tranquility of the moment but as Jon turns, she looks up to see him.

“Is it time yet?”

“No, not yet.” Jon kisses the crown of her head. “And what about you? The people fight for a glimpse of their new Queen. What is one poor man’s voice against so many? I wish you’d see Ser Davos, now.” He chuckles lightly, at the remembrance of his old and trusted companion running through the length of the courtyards, screaming orders to the stewards for the tables to be set, for the guests to be escorted to their seats, his face alarmingly red. “He looks like a hassled chicken.”

“Isn’t Brienne helping him?”

“Lady Brienne has more important things to do. Besides if Tormund keeps lurking around the stable-yards I don’t think she’ll ever set foot outside of this castle again.”

Sansa almost giggles, then controls herself, and turns to her work. “Look what I made,” she says.

On the table, lies a pair of neatly folded fur cloaks. Bridal furs, hand-made. Sansa brushes her palm over the soft fabric. “Jeyne said she wanted to bring over the finest tailors from King’s Landing to make us silk robes.”

“You refused?” Jon asks lightly. “You’d look splendid in silk, I think.”

“I refused.” Sansa says quietly. “This may sound childlike, but I want us to wear something that would bring to mind our House, not the fancy Southron lords. We Starks, we don’t prance about in satins and samite, ours is the old way, the way the North wants. We cannot afford to be lavish.”

“I see,” Jon says thoughtfully. He comes closer, pulls Sansa to him. “I don’t want you to feel like you’re giving up on anything.” He smiles. “I thought you’d want to be the grandest Queen in all of the Seven Kingdoms.”

Sansa’s dimples show despite herself. “Am I not, already?!-but I don’t speak in jest, Jon. And you never saw my work. The tailors of King’s Landing never had a Septa Mordane to show them the ways of the world!” she shakes out the cloaks for her betrothed to see.

It’s only wolf fur pelts on simple woolen cloaks, but Sansa’s butterfly-delicate embroidery makes them look lovelier than anything any Westerosi King or Queen had ever donned. Hers is in the shades of cream-and-gold, and below the waist, russet birds fly in-and-out a wilderness of rich red roses. The direwolf of their house is stamped in gold on the back. Jon’s is in black (in keeping with tradition, I suppose, he remarks to her amusement) and in silver threads Sansa has depicted the Targaryen dragon and the Stark direwolf against a backdrop of weirwoods. It’s a clever mix of her House hues with his.

Not for the first time, Jon is struck by a wave of pride at the seemingly endless arsenal of talents his wife-to-be unleashes every other day. She is talented, she is kind. She makes people feel at ease. The Realm calls her Queen Sansa the Good. And she is not even a queen yet, Jon thinks. They will go insane at the coronation. But first, the wedding. Jon feels a warm blaze within him, one he has not felt for many a day for a long, long time. However when he looks at Sansa, he sees her downcast face, and he knows something is amiss.

“Sansa?”

““Do you remember the last time I made us matching furs? That was the day we faced Ramsay, when we vowed to fight for our home at the cost of our lives.”

He remembers. How couldn’t he?

“ I’ll miss Winterfell. King’s Landing shall feel so strange.” She looks up and he sees her eyes are welling. “Do you know why I wanted to have our wedding in Winterfell? It’s where it all began, Jon. I had hated it here. And now I cannot bear to say goodbye.” A solitary tear falls upon the furs, which Sansa hastily brushes away.

“The Starks shall remain at Winterfell. Arya and Bran will be here to look after our home. And you’ll not be alone in King’s Landing like you’d been before, love. I’ll be at your side. You’ll never be alone again.”

She smiles through her tears. “This is why I made our wedding cloaks myself. I wanted to start my new life, but I am too cowardly to let go of my old one.”

“There is no shame in holding onto your memories, Sansa.” He knows this. He will miss Winterfell too. He’ll miss the godswood and the gardens and the snow and the cold. This is the place they grew up in. This is the place they fought to reclaim. More importantly, this is where they found solace in each other, much after hope had bled out of their lives in every which way. “You’ve been through so much. You’ve waited for this all your life. You deserve to be Queen, more than anyone I’ve ever met.” He stops. “I’ve met a few, I suppose.”

“Jon!”she smacks him on the elbow. He laughs, pulls her to an embrace. Outside, they hear Arya shout, “Alright, you both in there, get down to the godswood and make it lawful before you start lovering again! Seven hells.”

Sansa and Jon chuckle, and then he takes her hand, gazing into her lovely eyes. “Are you ready?”

“I am.”

“Good. Get the furs and let’s go put together your little fairytale.”

“There’s more comfort in familiarity than in fairytales, don’t you think?”

Jon only smiles. “So be it.”

also on ao3

(the themes of the story were inspired partially by the works of @jaylahve and @tiny-little-bird)

“I am.”

“Good. Get the furs and let’s go put together your little fairytale.”

“There’s more comfort in familiarity than in fairytales, don’t you think?”

Jon only smiles. “So be it.”

trail.content_raw:
A King, A Queen, A Cloak

written for @jonsadrabbles as a part of Jonsa Drabbles Fest Round 2 (lol “drabble”)

Day 6:  Tears 〜 Furs

Pairings: Jon Snow/Sansa Stark

Trigger warnings: none

Summary: The war is over. The Starks reign victorious. After a long courtship, Jon and Sansa decide to get married and move to King’s Landing where they’ll be named King and Queen. This is a nostalgic fic based on the day of their wedding :)

Mere hours before the ceremony begins, Jon finds Sansa in her old chambers, her head bent over her finished work, fawning like a proud mother of a newborn babe. He thinks of how endearing the picture is: early morning rays laving the room in a burnished glow, new décor on the chamber-walls painted like a foliage of birds, wafting essence of spring flowers from an open casement. And then there is Sansa herself: the play of sun in her red hair, water blue eyes like the sea sapphires of White Harbor. There is something poignant about the way she is seated-she looks like a saint. He decides to leave, to not destroy the fragile tranquility of the moment but as Jon turns, she looks up to see him.

“Is it time yet?”

[[MORE]]

“No, not yet.” Jon kisses the crown of her head. “And what about you? The people fight for a glimpse of their new Queen. What is one poor man’s voice against so many? I wish you’d see Ser Davos, now.” He chuckles lightly, at the remembrance of his old and trusted companion running through the length of the courtyards, screaming orders to the stewards for the tables to be set, for the guests to be escorted to their seats, his face alarmingly red. “He looks like a hassled chicken.”

“Isn’t Brienne helping him?”

“Lady Brienne has more important things to do. Besides if Tormund keeps lurking around the stable-yards I don’t think she’ll ever set foot outside of this castle again.”

Sansa almost giggles, then controls herself, and turns to her work. “Look what I made,” she says.

On the table, lies a pair of neatly folded fur cloaks. Bridal furs, hand-made. Sansa brushes her palm over the soft fabric. “Jeyne said she wanted to bring over the finest tailors from King’s Landing to make us silk robes.”

“You refused?” Jon asks lightly. “You’d look splendid in silk, I think.”

“I refused.” Sansa says quietly. “This may sound childlike, but I want us to wear something that would bring to mind our House, not the fancy Southron lords. We Starks, we don’t prance about in satins and samite, ours is the old way, the way the North wants. We cannot afford to be lavish.”

“I see,” Jon says thoughtfully. He comes closer, pulls Sansa to him. “I don’t want you to feel like you’re giving up on anything.” He smiles. “I thought you’d want to be the grandest Queen in all of the Seven Kingdoms.”

Sansa’s dimples show despite herself. “Am I not, already?!-but I don’t speak in jest, Jon. And you never saw my work. The tailors of King’s Landing never had a Septa Mordane to show them the ways of the world!” she shakes out the cloaks for her betrothed to see.

It’s only wolf fur pelts on simple woolen cloaks, but Sansa’s butterfly-delicate embroidery makes them look lovelier than anything any Westerosi King or Queen had ever donned. Hers is in the shades of cream-and-gold, and below the waist, russet birds fly in-and-out a wilderness of rich red roses. The direwolf of their house is stamped in gold on the back. Jon’s is in black (in keeping with tradition, I suppose, he remarks to her amusement) and in silver threads Sansa has depicted the Targaryen dragon and the Stark direwolf against a backdrop of weirwoods. It’s a clever mix of her House hues with his.

Not for the first time, Jon is struck by a wave of pride at the seemingly endless arsenal of talents his wife-to-be unleashes every other day. She is talented, she is kind. She makes people feel at ease. The Realm calls her Queen Sansa the Good. And she is not even a queen yet, Jon thinks. They will go insane at the coronation. But first, the wedding. Jon feels a warm blaze within him, one he has not felt for many a day for a long, long time. However when he looks at Sansa, he sees her downcast face, and he knows something is amiss.

“Sansa?”

““Do you remember the last time I made us matching furs? That was the day we faced Ramsay, when we vowed to fight for our home at the cost of our lives.”

He remembers. How couldn’t he?

“ I’ll miss Winterfell. King’s Landing shall feel so strange.” She looks up and he sees her eyes are welling. “Do you know why I wanted to have our wedding in Winterfell? It’s where it all began, Jon. I had hated it here. And now I cannot bear to say goodbye.” A solitary tear falls upon the furs, which Sansa hastily brushes away.

“The Starks shall remain at Winterfell. Arya and Bran will be here to look after our home. And you’ll not be alone in King’s Landing like you’d been before, love. I’ll be at your side. You’ll never be alone again.”

She smiles through her tears. “This is why I made our wedding cloaks myself. I wanted to start my new life, but I am too cowardly to let go of my old one.”

“There is no shame in holding onto your memories, Sansa.” He knows this. He will miss Winterfell too. He’ll miss the godswood and the gardens and the snow and the cold. This is the place they grew up in. This is the place they fought to reclaim. More importantly, this is where they found solace in each other, much after hope had bled out of their lives in every which way. “You’ve been through so much. You’ve waited for this all your life. You deserve to be Queen, more than anyone I’ve ever met.” He stops. “I’ve met a few, I suppose.”

“Jon!”she smacks him on the elbow. He laughs, pulls her to an embrace. Outside, they hear Arya shout, “Alright, you both in there, get down to the godswood and make it lawful before you start lovering again! Seven hells.”

Sansa and Jon chuckle, and then he takes her hand, gazing into her lovely eyes. “Are you ready?”

“I am.”

“Good. Get the furs and let’s go put together your little fairytale.”

“There’s more comfort in familiarity than in fairytales, don’t you think?”

Jon only smiles. “So be it.”

also on ao3

(the themes of the story were inspired partially by the works of @jaylahve and @tiny-little-bird)

It’s where it all began, Jon. I had hated it here. And now I cannot bear to say goodbye.” A solitary tear falls upon the furs, which Sansa hastily brushes away.

tags: he's the heir to the iron throne
summary: D&D: *dramatic music* He’s the heir to the Iron Throne. Okay, here’s the issue with that. For one thing, this pretty much...
body:
D&D: *dramatic music* He’s the heir to the Iron Throne.

Okay, here’s the issue with that. For one thing, this pretty much acknowledges that the Targaryens, no one else, should sit on the Iron Throne, which is…well, let’s just say it’s been controversial since Daenerys has been wanting it. I guess now that Jon is the “heir”, though, the people complaining about her ignorance and entitlement will now proceed to start preaching how the Targaryens are the true rulers since Jon is next in line.

Can I just point out how hypocritical some people in the GoT fandom are

But for another, more logical thing: after Rhaegar’s death, Aerys made Viserys his heir. He passed over Aegon and Rhaenys, Rhaegar’s children with Elia (yes, either him or Lyanna named Jon the same name as his first son, which is the absolute height of disrespect), and made his own child his heir. This either means that he removed Rhaegar’s line from succession entirely or bumped them down to after his own kids. Which means, even if we assume a bloodline that was overthrown is still the rightful royal family, Jon is still not the heir. 

So what the hell?

summary: lol most arya stans are jonerys people, lugging her in with those two. that's why they be acting all offended. going to her tag...
question: lol most arya stans are jonerys people, lugging her in with those two. that's why they be acting all offended. going to her tag is a nightmare these days.
answer: I don’t get why a fan of Arya would think she wants to be a servant of Daenerys Targaryen or wants her beloved brother reduced to the Kween’s fuck toy.  The Targaryens and Starks are at odds with each other.  Dany winning means the Starks lose.

life is hard enough without spelling checking
summary: Why Daenerys wanting to take back the iron throne in name of the Targaryans is not the same as Sansa and Jon wanting to take...
body:
Why Daenerys wanting to take back the iron throne in name of the Targaryans is not the same as Sansa and Jon wanting to take back Winterfell.


The explanation is very simple. Winterfell is Sansa and Jons home. They grew up there, Winterfell is a place, not a position of power, they want their house, of which they were unfairly kicked out off back. They did not care to become king or ruler of the North, they just wanted to go home.


Daenerys doesn’t want her house back, she wants her ancestors old power, which they lost fairly, back. If she just wanted to go home she would try to take back the house with the red door, since that is the place she considers home. Or even Dragonstone, because she was born there. But Dragonstone is not enough for her, she wants to rule Westeros.


The Targaryans where removed from power because they abused their power and the removal of an autority when that autority abused power is absolutely justitified.


People kicked the Starks out of their house. Plain and simple. They where threatend and had to leave for safety and afterwards their house was stolen by others.


That is the same situation of what happend with Viserys and Daenerys and the house with the red door. I would support her in trying to get her house back.


But the Iron Throne is not her house.

trail.content_raw:
Why Daenerys wanting to take back the iron throne in name of the Targaryans is not the same as Sansa and Jon wanting to take back Winterfell.


The explanation is very simple. Winterfell is Sansa and Jons home. They grew up there, Winterfell is a place, not a position of power, they want their house, of which they were unfairly kicked out off back. They did not care to become king or ruler of the North, they just wanted to go home.


Daenerys doesn’t want her house back, she wants her ancestors old power, which they lost fairly, back. If she just wanted to go home she would try to take back the house with the red door, since that is the place she considers home. Or even Dragonstone, because she was born there. But Dragonstone is not enough for her, she wants to rule Westeros.


The Targaryans where removed from power because they abused their power and the removal of an autority when that autority abused power is absolutely justitified.


People kicked the Starks out of their house. Plain and simple. They where threatend and had to leave for safety and afterwards their house was stolen by others.


That is the same situation of what happend with Viserys and Daenerys and the house with the red door. I would support her in trying to get her house back.


But the Iron Throne is not her house.

If she just wanted to go home she would try to take back the house with the red door, since that is the place she considers home. Or even Dragonstone, because she was born there. But Dragonstone is not enough for her, she wants to rule Westeros.


The Targaryans where removed from power because they abused their power and the removal of an autority when that autority abused power is absolutely justitified.


People kicked the Starks out of their house. Plain and simple. They where threatend and had to leave for safety and afterwards their house was stolen by others.


That is the same situation of what happend with Viserys and Daenerys and the house with the red door. I would support her in trying to get her house back.
